text: Hello guys, I’ve found out that rest api had been removed from fabric v0.7. How can I invoke commands?
<@U3D5886CB>  => GRPC
Okay. It is my understanding that chaincode can be deployed from git repository only?
with production-mode
(without —peer-chaincodedev)
<@U3D5886CB> with GO CC you can use local path visible from the peer

<@U3D5886CB> - no - with the REST API if you wanted to deploy remote chaincode (i.e. chaincode that was not in the local GOPATH for the peer) then yes - your code had to be available in a public git repository.   If you use the NodeJS SDK, then your chaincode needs to be local to the machine where you are running your SDK-based app so it can package it up and send it over to the peer.
<@U3CAX2JKW|shinji> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/shinji/F3CTPEJ0Z/-.txt|Untitled>

text: Hello, I try to work with the master branch but  when I start the peer, i have an error :

2016-12-12 11:15:05.734 GMT [committer] readUntilClose -> ERRO 07a Invalid transaction, error Invalid creator specified in the header

As mention in the previous logs
<@U3DHKV84C|yuryandreev> has joined the channel
In fact it seems to not be a problem to deploy my chaincode but
When I try to invoke it with :
peer chaincode invoke -n `mycc`  -c '{"Args":["invoke","a","b","10"]}'
as mention in   <https://jira.hyperledger.org/secure/attachment/10242/simple_test_with_skeletal_peer.md>
I have this error :
Error: Empty JSON chaincode parameters must contain the following keys: 'Args' or 'Function' and 'Args'

I was getting help the other week and someone mentioned that with the current master, *when working in development mode*, you have to restart your chaincode after you do the deploy command before you can start invoking on it
<@U3CAX2JKW> ^
in short: start chaincode, run deploy, stop chaincode, restart chaincode, start invoking
but only when running in dev mode, it's not necessary when not running in dev mode
What is the best way to debug ```2016-12-12 16:58:26.711 UTC [chaincode] processStream -> ERRO 202 Error handling chaincode support stream: stream error: code = 1 desc = "context canceled"``` ?
Output from `peer node`  whist deploying ( from master branch)
The deploy looks to be progressing well then I assume it encounters an error - just not too sure what the error could be?

<@U3BKMJZTK>  This message is okay per the last link here <https://wiki.hyperledger.org/community/fabric-design-docs>   (specifically, in the 'v1 end-to-end skeleton instructions'  where it explains that this message is OK to ignore, and why)
<@U0YJUECE8>  thanks - looking at the doc does say this is expected - my mistake must be some where else. Thanks again
<@U20M776SW|mdavid> has joined the channel
